SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AudioVerification
The AudioVerification class provides methods to verify the validity of audio files.
CreditsFrame
A frame displaying credits for the application.
ErrorLogger
The ErrorLogger class provides methods to log stack traces of exceptions to a file.
FancyJLabel
A JLabel subclass that provides additional features like text shadow.
GameController
The GameController class provides methods to configure and control the game.
GameFrame
The main frame for the game interface.
GameJPanel
JPanel for the main game interface.
GameOverScreen
Manages the game over screen, displaying game results and providing options for retrying, quitting to menu, or quitting to desktop.
GameUtils
The GameUtils class provides utility methods for the game.
LevelSelectionFrame
Represents the frame for selecting a level to play in the game.
Main
 
MidiPlayer
The MidiPlayer class handles the loading and playing of MIDI files for the game tracks.
MusicPlayer
The MusicPlayer class provides methods to play, pause, resume, and stop music or sound effects.
MusicPlayerManager
The MusicPlayerManager class manages a list of MusicPlayer instances.
MusicTrack
The MusicTrack class represents a track for notes in the game.
Note
The Note class represents a note in the game.
NoteMovingThread
The NoteMovingThread class represents a thread responsible for moving notes on a music track.
NotePool
The NotePool class represents a pool of notes that can be reused to optimize memory usage.
Ring
Represents a ring graphic that expands outward from a center point.
Score
The Score class manages the scoring and health mechanics of the game.
Score.HitType
Enumerates the types of hits and their corresponding score values.
SettingsFrame
 
SettingsManager
Manages game settings such as music volume, sound effects volume, game difficulty, note speed, and key bindings for game controls.
TitleFrame
Represents the title frame of the game, providing options to play, access settings, view credits, or quit the game.
